messages.body:
PLEASE ENDEAVOUR TO SEND YOUR REPLIES VIE MY PRIVATE EMAIL 
ADDRESS:mariam042002@jumpy.it

Dear Friend,
I am Mrs Mariam Abacha, the widow of Sani Abacha the late
Nigerian Head of State. You were introduced to me through
the Chamber of Commerce.
I am presently in distress while my son Mohammed is
undergoing trial in Lagos and Abuja. The government has
frozen all the family account and auctioned all our
properties. To save the family from total bankruptcy I have
managed to ship to Europe through a shipping company the
sum of US20.000,000.00 kept by my late husband.
The money was disguised to beat the Nigerian
security and it is currently deposited in a security
company in Europe. I want you to receive the money and pay
into your account for the family safely.
I am offering you 30% for assisting me secure this money
fast before it is located by the Nigerian Government
Agents. Contact me immediately with my email private addreass above so  that I
can forward to you all neccessary details.To
Fill The Application From, Kindly send your Home/Office
Address,Your phone and fax numbers for easy communication!
Best Regard

Mrs. Mariam Abacha

messages.body:
Dear Mr Williams,

Thank you for your e-mail.

You have probably received a rather irate e-mail from my client, Mr Mikhail Stroganov. Between oourselves I must inform you that he is a short-tempered gentleman and one must not take his occasional outbursts too personally. For instance, an error by one of my staff cost one of Mr Stroganov's companies US$10,000 and he shouted down the telephone at me for at least fifteen minutes. However, when I offered to dismiss the clerk who made the mistake, Mr Stroganov said that I should give the man one more chance because the fellow had a wife and six children to support.

I shall be travelling to Moscow on Friday for a meeting with Mr Stroganov so I suggest that we keep in touch for the present solely by e-mail. Or you can speak in strict confidence to my deputy Mr Joseph Kucker at xxxx@xxxxx.xxx.xx or call him on the telephone on 208 507 8833.

Incidentally, if there is a release fee to be paid to Global Security and Finance, I should tell you that at present it is unlikely that Mr Stroganov will release any US dollars as he is in the process of buying $18 million worth of American stocks. However, any charge could be paid in Canadian dollars, Scottish pounds sterling or Slovakian silver dorks. As Mrs Abacha's adviser, you may wish to recommend one of these currencies to her.

I look forward to hearing from you,
Charles Farnes-Barnes



Kindest regards
Dr Charles Farnes-Barnes BSc 
Senior Treasurer
Royal Bank of Dorsetshire

messages.body:
Dear Richard,

I have just returned to Britain after my meeting with Mr Stroganov. I must tell you that as I expected he was not in the best of spirits.

As you know, Russia has been knocked out of the Euro 2004 Football Championships but more importantly - and I tell you this in the STRICTEST CONFIDENCE - a Nigerian gentleman flew to see Mr Stroganov in Moscow with a plea for funds to help build a school for orphans whose parents were killed in the recent fighting vetween Christians and Moslems.

Mr Stroganov gave the man - one Ivor Babayaro - US $25,000 in cash only to be told that the fellow was a fraudster. Naturally, Mr Stroganov is furious and this explains his rather rude e-mail to you which accuses you of being dishonest.

However, I think I could persuade Mr Stroganov to continue with the transaction.

This is the problem: there is no real proof of the existence of this fund, and Mr Stroganov does not want to spend time and money to fly to Nigeria without hard evidence that this fund really exists.


You will agree that PROOF and TRUST are so important for they will GUARANTEE a GENUINE proposition.

Mr Stroganov is fifty years old in two week time.  I suggest that you send him by air mail a birthday card with a small gift - say a US one dollar bill. You can mail this to my home address.
This will show Mr Stroganov and myself exactly how much TRUST and CONFIDENCE you have in this business deal.

One receipt of this I promise that I will promise help you financially to complete this deal if needed.
With best wishes,

Charles Farnes-Barnes
